I had gastric bypass surgery so hair loss was a side effect and it was causing me depression because I was getting bald spots, but these vitamins are the real deal. I will attach some before and afters.

settings.specialized__what_content: Depression affects millions of people around the world. While it may not always directly result in hair loss, the effects of depression can be far reaching and unique to each individual. Depression often goes hand in hand with stress, and stress is known to cause hair loss. This type of hair loss is known as Telogen Effluvium. Telogen Effluvium is a temporary form of hair loss that typically occurs after a traumatic or stressful event has taken place. It often corrects itself within approximately 6 months.Depression may also trigger stress-related hair loss habits and disorders such as Trichotillomania. Also, stress can cause inflammation in the body and may onset hair loss symptoms for illnesses such as Alopecia Areata.

settings.title: Pictures Cannot Capture The Truth
settings.heading: Monica P
settings.ch_review_content:
Let's face it, I have very little hair. My hair started falling out when I started going through puberty at age 12. I'm now 44. I've tried many many different products that "guarantee" that I'd grow my hair, but sadly none worked. 
When I came across a Facebook ad for St. Tropica with pictures of those with hypothyroidism. (At that point, I hadn't even thought about my hypothyroidism being part of the problem.) I was looking into semi permanent wigs. I had just completely given up on my hair. I felt it was useless, but decided to give the challenge a try. 
I'm so glad I did!! Pictures really cannot capture the improvement because of how little hair I have. I have gotten new growth often however it always stops at a certain point & in just the same random spots. Usually falling out. Now with St. Tropica in about 2 weeks, I had new growth ALL OVER my scalp!! Not just in the same spots. It is even longer than it ever has been. The biggest surprise is that the front of my hair hasn't had new growth in... well I have no idea!! That part was always so smooth & I thought the follicles were completely dead. IT'S NOT!! 
My curls are so much more prominent. My hair has grown about 1 inch, if not more. My hair stopped falling after about a week. Rhe new growth was noticeable about 2 weeks kgo taking the vitamins. 
I know that you cannot see the difference in the pictures, YET! I have hypothyroidism, fibromyalgia, an absorption issue, plus more health problems. Also just for full disclosure 
(& not sympathy or pity), I am also dealing with great grief from the passing of my bonus daughter. Grief affects our body in SO MANY ways! It's like depression, anxiety, & stress on steroids times 10 on our bodies. Since I started St.Tropica vitamins, I have seen & felt improvement with my hair & skin. St. Tropica vitamins WORKS! ***Don't go by photos, but this testimony of the vitamins. ***

P.S. Pictures were taken with 2 different cameras. Also in the after pictures, I didn't know how greasy it is. My hair looks so much better than it shows. My apologies.
settings.ch_review_content2: I found St. Tropica in one of the lowest points of my life. My body was thrown into Cushing’s Disease after several rounds of steroid injections. Mentally and physically the hardest thing I had ever experienced, and of the symptoms was hair loss. I tried 2 other brands of hair vitamins and several brands of hair growth shampoos, with nothing gained other than deeper into my depression, Then, St Tropica, popped up and I thought, here I go again. Within 3 days, my husband thought I was crazy, but my hair felt softer. I took before pics only for myself, but then I finally got a much needed hair color and trim. My hair dresser could not believe the difference in my hair, and she cut a little more than 2 inches. When I had finished my bottle I took another picture just for myself, even still, with the hair trim, I could see a difference. My hair was right about back to the same length as when I started, and the texture was a huge difference, it even “looked” softer, smoother. So, my hope is that my review can help another person find a solution, I wish I had found you sooner. Thank you so much for all you do, Carla

settings.heading: What symptoms can be caused by Depression?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
While symptoms of depression vary from person to person there are a few symptoms that are most often experienced and these include:

  • An ongoing and persistent feeling of sadness, hopelessness, or emptiness
  • Irritability and/or anger
  • A loss of interest in hobbies, friends, social gatherings, or other normal activities
  • Sleeplessness or insomnia
  • Reduced or increased appetite
  • Anxiety
  • Tiredness
  • Difficulty concentrating

settings.heading: Are there treatment options for Depression?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans: Yes, there are treatment options available. We recommend speaking to your doctor to set up a plan to address your depression, as medication may be recommended for your treatment plan. They may also want to test you for health imbalances that are known to cause depression, such as thyroid disease. Your doctor may also recommend that you speak to a counselor, therapist, psychologist, or other mental healthcare professional to best address your depression.

settings.heading: Are there treatment options for hair loss caused by Depression?
settings.specialized__faqs_ans:
While we first recommend that you speak to your doctor, there are a few best practices related to hair care that you can implement to support your hair and hair regrowth journey:

Best hair care practices:

  • Use gentle hair care and avoid harsh ingredients such as parabens, phthalates, sulfates, and artificial fragrances.
  • Support your hair health and growth with Tru Bloom Vitamins. Our Tru Bloom Hair Vitamins have received thousands of positive reviews from real customers, many of whom have shared their hair and health journeys with us. Visit our 60-Day Challenge to see thousands of reviews and before/after photos.
  • Swap your cotton pillowcase for a satin one instead. Cotton can pull at your hair as you sleep, causing more breakage and damage to your hair. A satin pillowcase will allow your hair to move more freely and without damage. Side note: Satin pillowcases, unlike silk pillowcases, are a great vegan option.
  • Apply scalp treatments weekly. The Beach Goddess Hot Oil Hair Mask is a natural hair treatment to help deeply nourish your scalp and hair to support your best hair growth. This incredible Hot Oil Hair Mask contains proven Hair Superfoods, which can fully penetrate the human hair shaft - to repair & revitalize hair from the inside-out.
  • Reduce heat styling practices. Instead of using heat tools on your hair try to embrace your natural hair texture or use heatless hair styling methods. Heat tools can cause damage to your hair and may result in hair breakage.
